content.text:
LetLet me explore the current codebase structure to understand what we're working with. I can see from the git status that there was a spec file that got deleted (specs/002-ros2-nervous-system/spec.md), but there are recent commits related to ROS2 nervous system implementation. Let me investigate further.

```bash
find . -name "*.md" -type f | head -20
```

```bash
find . -name "*ros2*" -type f
```

```bash
find . -name "*nervous*" -type f
```

```bash
find . -path "./specs/*" -type f
```

```bash
git log --oneline -10
```

```bash
ls -la
```

```bash
find . -name "package.json" -o -name "requirements.txt" -o -name "pyproject.toml" -o -name "setup.py"
```

Let me look at the recent commits to understand what was in the spec that got deleted:

```bash
git show 5c493d4
```

```bash
git show a2050b0
```

```bash
git show 68d51d6
```

Let me check if there are any other spec files or documentation:

```bash
find . -name "*.md" | xargs grep -l -i "ros2\|nervous\|spec" 2>/dev/null || echo "No matching content found in markdown files"
```

Let me also check the tasks and plan files that were mentioned in the commits:

```bash
find . -name "*task*" -o -name "*plan*"
```

```bash
find . -path "./*" -name "*" | grep -E "(task|plan)" | head -20
```

```bash
find . -type f -exec grep -l "ros2\|nervous" {} \; 2>/dev/null | head -10
```

Let me look at the project root for any configuration files or documentation:

```bash
cat README.md 2>/dev/null || echo "README.md not found"
```

```bash
ls -la docs/ 2>/dev/null || echo "docs directory not found"
```

```bash
ls -la src/ 2>/dev/null || ls -la lib/ 2>/dev/null || echo "src/lib directories not found"
```

Let me check if there are any Python files that might contain the nervous system implementation:

```bash
find . -name "*.py" | head -10
```

Based on the git history, it seems we have a project focused on ROS2 nervous system implementation. The spec file was deleted but there are related commits. Let me examine what remains in terms of documentation or plans:

```bash
find . -name "*002*" -type f
```

```bash
find . -path "./specs/*" -o -path "./docs/*" -o -path "./plans/*" -o -path "./tasks/*" 2>/dev/null
```

Let me check if there's any project constitution file mentioned in the commits:

```bash
cat docs/project-constitution.md 2>/dev/null || cat project-constitution.md 2>/dev/null || echo "Project constitution not found at expected locations"
```

Let me also try to understand the overall project structure better:

```bash
find . -maxdepth 3 -type d | head -20
```

Let me look for any implementation files related to the nervous system:

```bash
find . -name "*.py" -exec grep -l -i "nervous\|ros2" {} \; 2>/dev/null
```

Now let me restore context by checking the full details of the recent commits:

```bash
git log --format=fuller -3
```
